reviews.review_msg: Dr. Maraun's classes are not "just math class" where one "memorizes formulas" and "plug in numbers". I  got to learn from him an overarching storyline / structure to describing, comparing, and analyzing behavioral data (e.g. in social sciences) that develops focus, concentration, attention to detail, and comprehsive understanding in psychometrics.

This prof elevated my understanding of stats and the common mistakes made in psyc research. Theres a learning curve that comes with trying to understand what he says during lectures, but if you go to office hours and ask for help, it eventually gets easier. Do all the practice exams, because those are essentially what will be tested.

Mike made stats bearable. I took it fall 2019 with him and went to almost every one of his office hours. If you want to do well, GO TO OFFICE HOURS. His midterms and finals are pretty much exactly like previous years so practice and go through the answers in office hours. If you ask him for more practice exams he'll give you some too!

He cares about his students and will give you proper training in statistic, no other nonsense. His ability to recognize what students are asking or need clarity on is astonishing. Despite COVID, he provided us with optimal lectures and Q&A office hours. He truly just wants his students to exceed, no tricks. Get to know him and ask many questions!

I was scared to take PSYC 301 but I didn't need to be. Mike doesn't use a textbook or lecture slides, but take good notes & you'll be fine. Go to his office hours; he'll give you practice exams and the answers. This class isn't difficult if you're willing to put in the work. If he sees you trying he is more than willing to help you succeed.
Mike is the most intelligent prof in the psychology department. He takes his work seriously... and if you don't take the course seriously then he won't take you seriously either.

He is an excellent lecturer, but his overemphasizes the importance of his office hour. You can miss all classes because the same material will be repeated by the TA next day, but office hour is must especially more practice exams,clarifications, even the perfect answer of the actual exam will be given, which is crucial to do well this course.

He loves stats & focuses on theory - great. But you MUST take verbatim notes in lecture. He doesn't speak concisely so good luck. His expectations are SO specific but never actually provided. Resources are non-existent (no canvas/slides/textbook). Office hrs once a week - attendance is basically mandatory bc you'll get exclusive handouts/answers

Dr. Maraun is a true scholar and teacher. He cares about the content that he teaches and wants students to show the same level of interest. I very much enjoyed his course and actually left the class with a greater appreciation for statistics.

Not a fan of his teaching style. Assignments require verbatim copying of lecture notes, huge marks are taken off for very minor mistakes, he makes sarcastic and unhelpful comments on exams and assignments... If you go to his office hour it makes a huge difference, but he only holds one per week and is unavailable otherwise.
Great prof! logical person, you will not only learn the course content but also learn the central ideas about doing science. Not a hard course if listen to the lecture carefully
If you immerse yourself in the material and go his to office hours, you'll be wondering what you were so worried about at the start. Not a tough course at all.

Doesn't respond to email but says you can phone him...he never answers though. He offers one office hour a week and if you can attend its quite helpful..If you cannot attend these hours, you are severely disadvantaged... and theres not much you can do about it. Most of the stuff he says goes against what the textbook says.
I found Mike to be arrogant and hard to approach. He seemed very insecure and was reluctant to share his knowledge, which was pathetic considering that it was his job to "teach" not to showoff.
I worked hard and learned a lot!
Difficult but useful course! Excellent prof! Explains material extremely well! His passion for the material and for teaching made the class much more enjoyable than I expected.
really hard class, and goes really fast.  But very helpful if you go to office hours.  Focuses on theory of stats rather than computational stuff

one of the greatest prof. ever had! although at first you will think he is cool and unapprochble but in fact he is really nice. Stat concept is very difficult I almost failed the midterm but at the end he gave me A-!! for him its not the mark that matter it is how much you understand that counts!!
Goes too fast in lecture, and is seemingly unapproachable--always seems irritated by students showing up at his office. Class is difficult, but not impossible

Very smart, passionate, and a capable teacher.  Personality clashes with everything and everyone.  WHEN he is interested in talking to you, he's among the finest profs I've seen.  When he's not interested, he's seneslessly abrasive.  Interesting.
difficult, but best prof/course i've had

Matt is honestly great! I took 301 and 391 with him and it was a steep learning curve for me. I knew nothing about coding and learned so much that's carried me really far in my research career. The tutorial sessions are awesome. Don't be nervous about the exams - all the questions are very fair and he's clear about his expectations. No surprises.

Dr. Sigal is passionate about stats & cares well for student growth. There is a heavy amount of content covered by the lectures, but justifiably - his explanations break down the stats & helps students understand the intuition/purpose in said stats. I now have a deeper understanding of stats, over other classes. ic is a phenomenal, caring TA.

Dr. Sigal is super nice and is very passionate about stats. Lectures are not boring but there is A LOT of information. He focused a lot on the program R and not so much on stats. The assignments and tutorial exercises were very simple compared to the midterm. Because of COVID we had a final assignment instead of an exam so can't speak to that.

If you don't like stats or coding you will hate this class. I found Matthew helpful, his lectures and slides were clear but I had to do A LOT of studying on my own time to stay on top of everything & make use of TA's time. Exams were hard and conceptual (you can't just regurgitate info). Assignments were simple/straightforward. DO NOT MISS A CLASS!

I would describe this class as painfully boring and confusing. It's not confusing because it's hard, it's confusing because he spends way too much time teaching code and too little time teaching the actual concepts. So you basically end up learning a bunch of code but have no idea how to actually do statistics properly.

doesn't explain concepts very clearly, slides are very vague and often no context with big blocks of code. But exams are pretty okay and straightforward comes directly from notes and assignments are easy. Lectures and labs both super boring with no breaks. Overall not the worst class, not the best, painfully average but better than Michael Mauran.
He is not very clear with expectations and is confusing in class. I wish there was more logical connection made between the different types of analyses we are learning. Take it with someone else.

I agree with others that she definitely likes to make you feel like you will never be as smart as her. Not a very motivating or approachable instructor. Her lectures are also boring to sit through. Im not sure why she assigns a textbook when she doesnt use it at all except for the tables in the back. Take it with someone else if you can.

Expect lengthy, detailed handouts, which Kate has designed to help you succeed (they contain everything you need to know). You can also expect detailed lectures for which you should be prepared to write fast. Kate also tells you EXACTLY what to study to do well on the midterm and final. Overall: a wise, excellent prof teaching a challenging course.
Not approachable and likes to make students feel stupid.

I didn't enjoy this class, not because it's statistics, but because Dr. Slaney was unapproachable and seemed to have little interest in helping the students. Her idea of "teaching" is to just stand in one spot and talk at you.

She's alrighh, but her lectures are just so dry and boring. Seems like she's just feeding you rehearsed lines and isn't very approachable. She gets upset when you point out mistakes in her notes and is very defensive. Makes students pay for a very expensive textbook and doesn't even use it.
Great course and very challenging as a university course should be. Lots of handouts used to help with book costs...very helpfull.

Definitely a challenging course, make sure you are prepared to put in the work before you take it. Notes are a bit long, but I'm glad to have them for reference. Exams were fair, make sure you define EVERYTHING. Assignments were picky but really allow you to apply your knowledge. She's an effective communicator and is really helpful in office hours

This is an intermediate stats course to prep Honours students, and if you are not prepared to *gasp* put in some actual work, then don't take this class. Kate wants you to understand the material and that's why she posts such comprehensive notes. Be familiar with the material before class to know where you're lacking and you will be fine.

Slaney is insane. She will bury you in an avalanche of work. She likes to give 20 page handouts (posted hours before her lectures) which you are supposed to magically memorize before the lecture.  If you take a class with her, I recommend the following: quit your job, drop all your other classes, and MAYBE you will pass. Or die trying.
I just took her Summer Intersession for this class.                                 She is very good.

Stats for psychology. Extremely difficult course, but Kate made it much less frustrating than I thought it would be. Made the material accessible (as much as is possible given the content). Only complaint: assignments were too long (27 pages for one question!). I don't know what all the haters are talking about; Kate Slaney's a great prof.
No Comments

Rochelle is a VERY nice person - very animated and obviously very interested in the material. Her lectures are a bit chaotic and disorderly although the exams are more than fair. Do not miss any classes as it will haunt you later (there is no webct component or recorded lectures for this class). Tutorial assignments had little relevence for exams.
